intro: Cavendishia corei, commonly known as the Core's cavendishia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup. The plant produces striking, colorful inflorescences that can last for several months. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
